description: From Middle French exulter, from Latin exsultō, frequentative of exsiliō (“jump up”), from ex- + saliō (“jump, leap”).

verbs.description: exult (third-person singular simple present exults, present participle exulting, simple past and past participle exulted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To rejoice; to be very happy, especially in triumph.
